issue.title: www.wort-suchen.de

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

comment.body:
Just to clarify - do you want users to check `https://dns.adguard-dns.com/info.txt`:

1. **With AdGuard DNS enabled** (DNS over TLS active in Android settings)
2. **With AdGuard DNS disabled** (DNS over TLS turned off in Android settings)

And compare both results?

issue.title: www.hood.de
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.hood.de/mein-hood.htm](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.hood.de%2Fmein-hood.htm) ### Comment > Mit AdGuard ist kein Login auf hood.de mglich, die Seite beschwert sich ber angeblich blockierte Cookies. Mit deaktiviertem AdGuard funktioniert der Login. > Abschalten einzelner AdGuard-Funktionen wie "Trackng protection" (insbesondere Deaktivieren von "Tracking methods" wie "Delete third-party cookies") oder "Browsing Security" hilft nicht, es kommt dieselbe Fehlermeldung zu den Cookies. Nur komplettes Deaktivieren von AdGuard auf hood.de fhrt zu einem erfolgreichen Login. ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://tuoitre.vn](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftuoitre.vn) ### Comment > Hello AdGuard Team, > > Our domain https://js.aiservice.vn/rec is part of a recommendation service that provides contextual content recommendations for publishers. > > Currently, this service is being used on the following website: > > https://tuoitre.vn/ > > The service does not: > > serve intrusive or disruptive advertisements > > perform cross-site tracking > > use fingerprinting or similar tracking techniques > > All recommended or sponsored content is clearly labeled, and the system operates in a privacy-friendly manner. > > We believe that the following blocking rule is a false positive, especially when applied to tuoitre.vn: > > Blocked rule: > ||js.aiservice.vn^ > > Filter list: > AdGuard Mobile Ads > > We kindly request that you review this rule and consider removing or exempting it for https://tuoitre.vn/. > > Thank you very much for your time and consideration. > > Best regards, > Thanh Phan ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://tuoitre.vn](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftuoitre.vn) ### Comment > Hello AdGuard Team, > > Our domain https://js.aiservice.vn/rec is part of a recommendation service that provides contextual content recommendations for publishers. > > Currently, this service is being used on the following website: > > https://tuoitre.vn/ > > The service does not: > > serve intrusive or disruptive advertisements > > perform cross-site tracking > > use fingerprinting or similar tracking techniques > > All recommended or sponsored content is clearly labeled, and the system operates in a privacy-friendly manner. > > We believe that the following blocking rule is a false positive, especially when applied to tuoitre.vn: > > Blocked rule: > ||js.aiservice.vn^ > > Filter list: > AdGuard Mobile Ads > > We kindly request that you review this rule and consider removing or exempting it for https://tuoitre.vn/. > > Thank you very much for your time and consideration. > > Best regards, > Thanh Phan ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/bqinqev3p48oksc8gswk4ww88oskgckrdfol1flpcg.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/laim30jjwlwo0k4cwwgwwc004o084gkq9hqjegsvr4.png?nc=1)

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://tuoitre.vn/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftuoitre.vn%2F) ### Comment > On the stream of news, i have 7 AI recommended news on top, then the news we set. > - When enable Adguard the 7 AI news disappear, and the top news is what we set. > - We would like to keep those 7 AI news on top although Adguard is enable. ### Screenshots

issue.title: boredpanda.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Cannot reproduce
labels.description: Filters devs cannot reproduce this issue

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [http://boredpanda.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fboredpanda.com) ### Comment > admiral blocks page ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/jij3swn6glws0c80c0k404gk08s48ogfdzvur0yijs.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Android v4.12.2 System version: | `Android 16` Browser: | Chrome License type: | paid AdGuard mode: | VPN HTTPS filtering: | enabled Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Send Do-Not-Track header

**Tracking methods**:
Self-destructing third-party cookies (180),
Self-destructing first-party cookies (4320)

**Miscellaneous**:
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests DNS filtering: | server: `System`
filters: `https://filters.adtidy.org/android/filters/15_optimized.txt` Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads,
EasyList

Peter Lowe's Blocklist

Annoyances:

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots

</details>

issue.title: m.naver.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://m.naver.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fm.naver.com)
### Comment
> Hello, this is the Naver Development Team.
> 
> One of our team members previously contacted AdGuard support regarding an issue with Naver services when using AdGuard DNS, reporting that Android users with AdGuard DNS (dns.adguard.com) cannot access naver.com domains. We received confirmation from AdGuard support that naver.com domains are not blocked.
> 
> As a follow-up, we would like to provide additional details about the ongoing issue.
> 
> **Issue Overview:**
> We have recently received numerous reports from customers experiencing difficulties accessing Naver-related services through Android apps (Chrome, Google app, Naver app, etc.) when using AdGuard DNS. Based on customer inquiries and internal reproduction tests, we have confirmed that this issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS in conjunction with LG U+, a major network provider in South Korea.
> 
> **Symptoms:**
> * Various Naver services (Naver Search, Naver Shopping, Naver News, etc.) are inaccessible or fail to load properly
>   > For example, when accessing "m.naver.com" through mobile Chrome or Google app, users encounter errors such as "Unable to connect to the Internet" or "This site can't be reached"
>   > Web pages fail to load in browser apps, displaying ERR_NAME_NOT_RESOLVED errors
> * The issue is primarily reported by Android users
> * The problem occurs intermittently (not continuously), sometimes lasting several minutes
> * Our internal testing confirms the issue occurs specifically when using AdGuard DNS with the LG U+ network
>   > Configuration: Phone Settings > Connections > More connection settings > Private DNS > dns.adguard-dns.com (or dns.adguard.com)
> 
> **Actions Taken:**
> The Naver development team has contacted the LG U+ network team to investigate this issue further. We are reaching out to request AdGuard's cooperation as well, as this appears to be an interaction between AdGuard DNS and the LG U+ network that is affecting our users' ability to access Naver services.
> 
> We appreciate your assistance in resolving this matter.

### Screenshots

comment.body: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/222099#issue-3790583968 - Website has been unblocked.

As far as I can see, initially it was in the Base filter - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/89cc1f389b34a8fba5d52ae2e820fe3198856ded
But as I recall, later it was decided that if there is subscription option offered, then it should be fixed in annoyance filter.

comment.body:
Similar rule seems to be already in Annoyance filter:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/75363d84be7afa8ec5f604128db1244815d1b439/AnnoyancesFilter/Popups/sections/antiadblock.txt#L2007

> But as I recall, later it was decided that if there is subscription option offered, then it should be fixed in annoyance filter.

Likely due to this policy.
https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/filter-policy/#:~:text=They%20provide%20an%20alternative%20to%20disabling%20an%20ad%20blocker%20given%20that%20this%20alternative%20does%20not%20put%20the%20users%E2%80%99%20privacy%20or%20security%20at%20risk

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://open.spotify.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fopen.spotify.com%2F) ### Comment > Spotify player gets stuck on ads sometimes on web player with AdGuard enabled - no songs, nothing, not even ad plays. Only solution is to refresh the browser and replay the playlist. Trying to change playlist doesn't work either, completely stuck playerand now playing view. While with AdGuard disabled, ads load normally and player works as intended. One important thing: It happens after 2-3 times ads are skipped. e.g I open player, play a playlist, ads come normally due course, gets skipped twice or even thrice, songs playing uninterrupted, after that it gets stuck on ad and nothing plays. Like spotify detects adblocker is on after 2-3 skips and blocks plays (guess). ### Screenshots

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

issue.title: spaces.im
issue.body: ### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Mac ### AdGuard version 2.18.0.2089 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? Safari ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://spaces.im ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. AdGuard incorrectly blocks lp.spac.me as a tracking server. In reality, this domain is used for WebSocket/long-polling updates (IM, chat, notifications, etc.) for logged-in users. 2. Screenshot of problem: The domain appears in this file: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/5692224dbfc8e9e325c98f7249acc9148d4b1d63/SpywareFilter/sections/tracking_servers_firstparty.txt#L942 Problematic commit: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/e8344447aff255aaf823a89aa2c98740a4754e21 ### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

issue.title: mytotalconnectcomfort.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots

issue.title: world79.spcs.bio
issue.body:
### Prerequisites - [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml); - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue; - [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date; - [x] Browser version is up-to-date; - [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue. ### What product do you use? AdGuard for Mac, AdGuard Browser Extension ### AdGuard version 2.7.7 ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? Chrome ### Which device do you use? Desktop ### Where is the problem encountered? https://world79.spcs.bio/ ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. AdGuard blocks requests to `/api/common/beacon`, but this API request is critical for normal site usage. It is used to keep the current session "still alive". Without it, WebSocket/long-polling events are not delivered to the browser when the site tab is in the background. This API is also used to subscribe the user to comment updates when reading blog or forum threads. This is not tracking - it's core functionality. The problem appears in this file: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/55e0771cf90a82f361c3d74f6f0580d6f8dd600c/SpywareFilter/sections/specific.txt#L1711 Problematic commit: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/commit/e8344447aff255aaf823a89aa2c98740a4754e21 2. Screenshots
Screenshot 1:
Screenshot 2:
Screenshot 3:
### Privacy - [x] I agree to follow this condition

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://ablyft.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fablyft.com)
### Comment
> Hello AdGuard DNS Team,
> 
> we recently discovered that our domain / service ABlyft is being blocked by AdGuard DNS and appears to be listed in your Advertising Networks filter list:
> https://adguardteam.github.io/AdGuardSDNSFilter/Filters/filter.txt (under the section "third-party advertising networks domains).
> 
> We believe this is a false positive and would kindly ask you to review and remove ABlyft from that list.
> 
> ABlyft is an experimentation and personalization platform (A/B testing, feature testing, personalization).
> We do not serve ads, do not operate an advertising network, and do not perform any advertising-related tracking.
> Our scripts are used solely by our customers to improve user experience.
> 
> Blocking our service breaks core functionality for many businesses who rely on ABlyft for website optimization and experimentation, even though no advertising is involved.
> 
> If you need any additional technical details about how ABlyft works or how our scripts are used, we would be happy to provide them.
> 
> Thank you very much for your time and support - we truly appreciate the important work you are doing for the community.

issue.title: mytotalconnectcomfort.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://mytotalconnectcomfort.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmytotalconnectcomfort.com) ### Comment > This is the site I use to control my thermostat in my home so I need it to be working. I've been through extensive troubleshooting to fix this over the past few weeks and I had to take my computer to a specialist for $80 to determine that the issue is caused by AdGuard. I didn't think it was initially because I disabled AdGuard on this site and it still wouldn't load. However, he pointed out that if I completely exit AdGuard, then the site will load properly. My screenshots are of AdGuard still running on my computer, but with it disabled on the site, and the site will not load with "ERROR_CONNECTION_CLOSED". The second screenshot is after completely exiting AdGuard and not allowing it to run in the background and the site works normally. ``` Username: @JackLGM ``` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
Hello,
There is no way to block ads in this app without breaking the weather map.
I recommend installing the older version of the app, which still allows you to disable ads (25.8.31), or using the web version in your browser.

issue.title: fix #222140 wnflb2023.com

comment.body:
> clear site specific cookie/data /cache free reload

I did that on Firefox, and I added your rule before I even loaded it on Chrome, so I find it hard to believe I had site cache for a site I had never been to.

Edit: The same thing just happened on Edge and it was my first time ever loading it on Edge.

issue.title: fix #222140 wnflb2023.com

comment.body: clear site specific cookie/data /cache free reload

issue.title: fix #222140 wnflb2023.com

comment.body: It might also be worth adding `wnflb2023.com#%#//scriptlet('set-constant', 'unadblock', 'noopFunc')` as `||wnflb2023.com/source/plugin/unadblock/`, does not always seem to block it. I tested on Firefox and Chrome, and the same thing happened.

comment.body:
It seems that it's caused by `EasyList Czech and Slovak` filter list.
As a temporary solution please add following rule to user rules:
```adblock
sauto.cz#@#div[class^="p-uw-item-list"] ul > :not(li[class*="c-item"])
```

<hr>

@sebm253 Could you please take a look?
Seems to be caused by - https://github.com/tomasko126/easylistczechandslovak/commit/b5b51b486b3b8443096ab7202019ca49240134e8#diff-707a64cce0a36f66baf14f442fe190129bd5b33e7bcbdd3b5021358235fc50a4R526

comment.body:
I'm getting Ad-Shield errors on many of the sites in this rule. Are you able to reproduce it?
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/86e248a11168e4c391cf8962e09d00b0ec79bd04/BaseFilter/sections/specific.txt#L158

Note: using chrome.
Usually `#$#body { overflow: auto !important; }` is safe (if only `overflow` must be changed)

As I see, only a.klaviyo.com/client/subscriptions/ should be unblocked. 
Please test again (with a temporary email)

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973
